metadata.title: CVE-2013-6640 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The DehoistArrayIndex function in hydrogen-dehoist.cc (aka hydrogen.cc) inGoogle V8 before 3.22.24.7, as used in Google Chrome before 31.0.1650.63,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read)via JavaScript code that sets a variable to the value of an array elementwith a crafted index.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-6640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-chromedriver - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '31.0.1650.63-0ubuntu1~20131204.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
